page.title: 15GOWY VALLEY ECOLOGY,BIRDS
page.content: Common{BIRDS}Blackbird,Thrush,Robin & Tits. Martins,Swallows & Swifts nest under the eaves of houses.Sparrows, Starlings,Magpies and Crows abound. Kingfisher,Woodpecker,Gold/Greenfinch Nuthatch,Wren,Coot,Swan,Owl and Heron can be found.Water meadows of the Gowy support breeding waders.Farmland has Bunting,Lark,Pipits,migrant Fieldfares and Redwing.About 50 species breed in total. {FOOTPATHS}Great Barrow was the centre of schooling for the area,the number of footpaths entering the Parish reflect this.They are in good repair & a local Footpath Society exists.Some of Littletons' paths are not passable, vandalism & rubbish in the dew ponds have led to farmers discouraging easy access.Guilden Sutton has many paths these are mainly tarmaced and used by estate dwellers.
